commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor Glen.java for Better Code Organization
commitResults.messageBody:
Refactoring Glen.java for Better Code Organization

The original Glen class was handling multiple responsibilities, including user interaction, parsing, task management, and storage. This made the code less modular and harder to maintain.

To improve the code organization, the class has been refactored into three separate classes: Glen, Ui, and Parser.

- Glen class now focuses on managing the flow of the chatbot, interacting with the user through the console, and orchestrating the operations between the Ui, Parser, TaskList, and Storage classes.
- Ui class is responsible for handling the user interface, including displaying introduction and exit messages.
- Parser class now handles the parsing of user input and delegates the corresponding tasks to the TaskList and Storage classes.

This separation of concerns leads to cleaner, more modular code, making it easier to understand, extend, and maintain in the future.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor type checks to utilize instanceof
commitResults.messageBody:
Refactoring type checks to utilize instanceof -- improve code readability and maintainability

The original code used nested try-catch blocks with ClassCastException to determine the type of the 'task' object. This approach can be confusing and less efficient.

In the edited code, I replaced the try-catch blocks with a series of if-else statements that utilize the instanceof operator to check the type of 'task'. This change improves code readability and makes it easier to understand the logic. Additionally, it provides better performance as exceptions are costly in terms of computational resources.

This commit improves code quality by enhancing readability, maintainability, and efficiency. It adheres to best practices for type checking and helps prevent potential exceptions, resulting in more robust code.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Java assertions to affirm correctness of assumptions
commitResults.messageBody:
The code lacks Java assertions, making it challenging to document assumptions which are critical at various points in the code.

Adding Java assertions is crucial for documenting assumptions. It
helps identify and also prevent unexpected issues during
development and runtime.

This commit introduces Java assertions at key points in the codebase.

This enhances code clarity and maintainability, and improves code readability across multiple classes.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update and rename src/main/java/Deadline.java to src/main/java/glen/task/Deadline.java
Update and rename src/main/java/Event.java to src/main/java/glen/task/Event.java
Update and rename src/main/java/Task.java to src/main/java/glen/task/Task.java
Update and rename src/main/java/Todo.java to src/main/java/glen/task/Todo.java
Update and rename src/main/java/Parser.java to src/main/java/glen/util/Parser.java
Update and rename src/main/java/Storage.java to src/main/java/glen/util/Storage.java
Update and rename src/main/java/TaskList.java to src/main/java/glen/util/TaskList.java
Update and rename src/main/java/Ui.java to src/main/java/glen/util/Ui.java
Update and rename src/main/java/Glen.java to src/main/java/glen/Glen.java
Organise the classes into suitable Java packages
commitResults.messageBody:
Refactor project directory structure for better organization

The current project structure lacks a clear organization, making it difficult to navigate and maintain. To address this issue, the directory structure has been reorganized.

Moved all .java files into a 'duke' package to encapsulate the main application logic and make it more modular.
Created 'task' sub-package to house Deadline, Event, Task, Todo
Also created 'util' sub-package to house Parser, Storage, StringToDateTime, TaskList, Ui, to provide a more structured approach to managing utility classes.
This reorganization follows Java's recommended package naming conventions, improving code readability and maintainability.

Additionally, this change enables better scalability for future feature additions or modifications.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add JUnit tests for Parser, Storage, and TaskList
commitResults.messageBody:
The current codebase lacks automated tests, which makes it prone to regressions and hard to maintain.

By adding JUnit test classes for the mentioned classes, we can ensure that the code functions as expected and catch any potential issues early in development.

I have created separate JUnit test classes for each of the classes to thoroughly test their functionality. Each test class contains test cases for various scenarios, including edge cases and boundary conditions. This approach ensures comprehensive coverage of the codebase.

Additionally, I have followed best practices for writing unit tests, including using descriptive test method names, organizing tests into logical groups, and using assertions to validate expected outcomes. This makes the tests easy to read, understand, and maintain. This commit also includes the necessary setup for running the tests, such as adding dependencies to the build file and configuring the test runner.

Overall, this approach will lead to more robust and reliable code, making it easier to develop and maintain the application in the long run.
